content.rendered:
Ayda Akbarzadeh

Ayda is a data analyst consultant who enjoys using data to address the challenges of our time.She holds a bachelor’s degree in IT, with experience spanning a multitude of industries: Data analytics, IT, entrepreneurship, management and education.
Ayda has a deep rooted love for educating children which led her to establish a successful primary school in her hometown. Ayda has always been open to exploring new avenues in life.

Having worked in the IT and business sector, she had developed an appreciation for the role data can play in the success of projects. Therefore, after migrating to Australia, she joined The Data School where she could further grow her knowledge in the field of data analytics. Ayda aspires to make lasting contributions to the world by deciphering data and communicating the insights to decision makers in a clear and simple way.

Ayda enjoys fostering meaningful relationships and is described by her friends as a caring person who is always ready to go out of her way to make life easier for them. Ayda loves the outdoors and enjoys exploring nature anywhere anytime. She has a unique connection with the sea and enjoys sitting on the beach and watching the waves arise and dissipate. Watching the moon in the sky at night also calms her down. Writing diaries and recording her unique and creative ideas in her idea’s notebook are her other hobbies. Also, one of her dreams is writing her life’s book or even making a movie of it.

  • Follow
  • Follow
  • Follow

content.rendered:
Terry Zhou

Terry is a graduate from the University of Melbourne, having obtained his Master’s degree in Applied Psychology. He discovered his passion for data analytics through his university coursework and his experience as a research intern, where he was regularly involved in designing experiments and analysing experimental data. To turn his passion into his career, Terry joined The Data School to further hone his skills as a data analyst, and to expand the tools he has for insight generation. His areas of interest are consumer behaviour, decision-making, and behaviour change.

Outside of work, Terry is a film photography enthusiast, having amassed a small collection film cameras ever since he picked up the hobby in high school (much to the annoyance of his parents). He also enjoys playing video games with his friends (previously much to the annoyance of his parents), and would often fantasise about building his perfect computer. If he could only eat one type of food for the rest of his life, it would be burgers.

content.rendered:
Jude Shu

I am a graduate with a Science degree, a Post Graduate with a Certificate in Applied Statistics, and over 14 years of experience in the telecommunications Industry. I was drawn to the data school because I love working with data to enable more intelligent decisions and drive predictive capabilities. As a curious individual with an eye for detail, I solve problems by turning the most complex data sets into timely and actionable insights through clear, interactive, and user-friendly dashboards, creative thinking, and industry expertise.

Consumer Pricing Index and Wages Growth – Australian Bureau of Statistics

Understanding the basics of creating Charts in Tableau

by Jude Shu | Jul 9, 2022 | Jude Shu

A key to a successful application to the Data School Down Under

by Jude Shu | Jun 21, 2022 | Jude Shu

My Journey securing a spot at The Data School

content.rendered:
Yimin Long

Holding a Bachelor of Computer Science and coming from an IT background, Yimin’s love of data can be traced back long ago to his Software Developer career stage. Dealing with SQL database, writing SQL to help troubleshooting the coding outcome had been his daily task. Also, before joining The Data School, Yimin had over 3+ years’ experience in teaching Scratch and Python coding for children. By creating and constantly refining the course contents, his logical thinking ability had been further elevated, helping him gain more readiness in his new data analysis adventures. By joining The Data School, he found the catalyst for his passion for finding insights from complex data and solving technical challenges.

When away from the screen, Yimin loves exploring the lakes and beaches for a productive fishing spot. He also enjoys gardening, cooking, and travelling, and won’t miss a change to have relaxed chats and walks with friends.

Dashboard Week Day 3 — Working with the Star Wars API

by Yimin Long | Sep 8, 2022 | Yimin Long

The data we get for dashboard week day 3 is the Star Wars data from the online API. The API has the data related to the first two trilogies of the Star Wars Movies. We can find the data for all the six movies, including the films themselves and the People, Planets,...

Dashboard Week Day 1 — Global Power Plant

by Yimin Long | Sep 6, 2022 | Yimin Long

Finally we are here, the Dashboard week. A dashboard challenge each day. Day 1 we have the Global Power Plant dataset to work with. I'll break this blog down into two parts to summarize the key things I did to make the dashboard for this analysis. Data preparation In...

Thanh Ho

Thanh graduated from the University of South Australia with a Bachelor of Applied Finance. After acquiring more than 7 years of experience in the area of energy, gas and solar, Thanh wanted to follow his passion for numbers and statistics and sought out the data school to commence his career as a data analyst. Thanh enjoys strategy and thinking games, and would never turn down a plate of Pad Thai.

content.rendered:
Martin Ding

Martin earned his Honours degree in Economics at the University of Melbourne in 2011. He has more than 7 years of experience in product development, both as an entrepreneur and as a project manager in robotics at an AI unicorn.

Martin is expecting to receive his Master’s degree in Data Science from CU Boulder at the end of 2022. Martin is excited about data and it’s power to transform organizations. He witnessed at first hand of how instrumental data driven decision making (DDDM) was in leading to more team buy-in and insightful decisions.

Martin joined the Data School to systematically enhance his knowledge of the tools, methodologies and know-how of Data Analytics and DDDM. When not working, Martin enjoys readings, cooking, traveling and golf. He also thoroughly interested in the practice of mindfulness and meditation.

content.rendered:
Huelder Cleslei Dos Santos

Huelder holds a Bachelor of Production Engineering and an MBA in Project Management. He has 15 years of experience working in a variety of industries such as mining, manufacturing and construction. His passion for data analytics came from his experience working in process improvement projects, where data analytics was employed to find opportunities to make improvements.

Huelder has joined The Data school to follow his passion and to discover insights using data analysis and visualisation tools. Huelder enjoys catching up with friends, trying different foods, watching movies, travelling, hiking and reading.

Tableau is a visual analytics tool and it  provides excellent analytical based on map to give you insights. Now we are going to talk about how to customise the look of your map. First you need to select the option “Map” on menu and “Background Layers”. On the...

by Huelder Cleslei Dos Santos | Sep 18, 2022 | Huelder Cleslei Dos Santos

Do you know how to add interactivity and expand or collapse container in Tableau? If not, let`s learn how to do it. First of all, you need to select a new dashboard and then drag a vertical container into the canvas. You will notice that the container will get the...

Performance of forward Players at AFL

by Huelder Cleslei Dos Santos | Sep 9, 2022 | Huelder Cleslei Dos Santos

The Australian Football League is the pre-eminent and only fully professional competition of Australian rules football. Through the AFL Commission, the AFL also serves as the sport's governing body and is responsible for controlling the laws of the game. Now I am...

Australia Migration – Census

by Huelder Cleslei Dos Santos | Sep 9, 2022 | Huelder Cleslei Dos Santos

The 2021 Census counted 25,422,788 people in Australia, excluding overseas visitors, and provides insight on areas including cultural diversity, families and homes, and how the country changed during the pandemic. This is more than double the number counted 50 years...

Star Wars

by Huelder Cleslei Dos Santos | Sep 8, 2022 | Huelder Cleslei Dos Santos

A long time ago, there was a galaxy far, far away, with lots and lots of planets. Star Wars is an American epic space-opera multimedia franchise created by George Lucas, which began with the eponymous 1977 film and quickly became a worldwide pop-culture phenomenon....

Consumer Price Index – Australia

by Huelder Cleslei Dos Santos | Sep 7, 2022 | Huelder Cleslei Dos Santos

Consumer Price Index (CPI) is the most acceptable indicator of Inflation/Deflation which measures the percentage change in the price of a basket of goods and services consumed by residents. This 'basket of good' covers a wide range of goods and services, arranged in...

Generated Energy by Country per Fuel Source

by Huelder Cleslei Dos Santos | Sep 6, 2022 | Huelder Cleslei Dos Santos

Driven by higher energy demand, global energy-related CO2 emissions rose to a historic high of 33.1 Gt CO2. While overall emissions from all fossil fuels increased, the power sector accounted for nearly two-thirds of emissions growth. This is a big concern since CO2...

Using Cross Tab and Transpose in Alteryx

by Huelder Cleslei Dos Santos | Aug 28, 2022 | Huelder Cleslei Dos Santos, Uncategorized

The Cross Tab and Transpose tools allow you to make transformation on the structure of the table. Cross Tab is very useful when you need to have categorical data. With the Cross Tab you will be able to divide the data into mutually groups as you can see the example...

How useful the Fuzzy Matching is?

by Huelder Cleslei Dos Santos | Jul 24, 2022 | Huelder Cleslei Dos Santos

Fuzzy Matching is a tool that provide a method to process phrases or strings from the database finding matches between two elements. It also provides the score to show up the accuracy of the match by choose the threshold. Eventually you are going to get some dataset...

content.rendered:
Antoneely Calizaya

Antoneely is a curious and lifelong learner, and she has become fascinated by a wide variety of business challenges she has encountered throughout her career. She is currently pursuing a Master’s in Business Analytics and has a Bachelor’s in Management and Marketing. She is passionate about data-driven decision making and enjoys working with complex data problems.

She has six years of experience including a mid-level position in management, developing projects and implementing strategies. When she matched her passions and interests, it was clear that she wanted to learn as much as she could about data analysis, data science, machine learning, and new technologies. Her favourite new platforms are Alteryx and Tableau. She’s constantly seeking new things to learn and is always up for new ways to challenge herself. She finds fascinating books about the brain, creativity, subconscious mind, and mindfulness.

She enjoys hosting meetups related to fun outdoor activities. The latest hobbies she enjoys are pole fitness, video editing, illustrating with her Wacom, and she’s looking to join a footy team. Antoneely’s long-term goal is to use all her data superpowers to contribute to improving access to equitable and quality education, emphasising rural areas, and vulnerable populations.

content.rendered:
Andrew Ho

Andrew joins The Data School Down Under with more than 10 years in a variety of fields, mostly in hospitality and administration. Aftering identifying an interest in visualisations with Tableau Andrew decided to further his skills in data analytics .

He now aims to use data to enhance insights and assist businesses in making informed decisions while learning and growing in this industry. Outside of work, Andrew enjoys spending his time cuddling his dog and being a bed for his two cats. He always keen on trying new cuisines and travelling around the world.
